section.div:
M.E.S. Kalladi College, Mannarkkad is a Government Aided college is affiliated to University of Calicut. The college started functioning as a Junior College in 1967. University of Calicut permitted to start degree classes during 1971-72. The campus is situated in the Mannarkkad Panchayath on a beautiful hillock in the Palakkad-Calicut National Highway and is bordered by the perennial Kunthipuzha and fortressed by panoramic Attapadi hills.
The college is the proud symbol of the Muslim Educational Society, which is one of the largest minority educational agency in India. This is the first college started by the MES to the cause of higher education in Kerala, especially to the educationally backward areas of Malabar. The vision and mission statement of the college are in tune with the objectives of the Higher Education Policy. The college offers seven UG programmes, six PG programmes and eight Certificate programmes. The administration implemented the Decentralized mechanism for quality improvement.
A meeting of the Management with the Internal Quality Assurance Cell and Planning forum has been convened to formulate a strategic plan of the institution based on the NAAC Peer Team report on Institutional Re- accreditation of 22nd November, 2012 suggested recommendations for quality enhancement of the institution. The meeting analyzed the recommendations of the report in detail and thrust areas were identified to transform the institution to “Autonomous status and Potential of Excellence”. The areas identified by the meeting are Inclusive Excellence, Digital Campus, Building Students Ability, Research, Green Campus, Sports, Community Building and Infrastructure
The meeting entrusted faculty members for monitoring the progress. There will be three level target achievement analysis Short term (2014-16J, Midterm (2016-18J and Vision accomplishment [2020). The funds required will be mobilized from Management and Government funding agencies.
The strategic plan is signed on 20th March,2013
